isis.stitle: 5 SPEED AND 6 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON SERIES - INSTALL - SETTING END PLAY (FS-5205)

note.para: Setting end play is done in both the horizontal and vertical position.
When setting end play, the front bearing cover, yoke and output shaft nut will be installed, removed, and installed again.
After end play is correct, apply a light coat of Loctite 242 or equivalent to both sides of the shims.

step1.para: Loosen the front bearing cover bolts to 30 in-lbs. (3 N• m) ( Figure 182).

figure.caption: Figure 182. Loosen Front Bearing Cover Bolts and Record Gap Between Front Bearing Cover and Case

step1.para: At the bolt locations, use two feeler gauges to record the gap between the front bearing cover and the case ( Figure 182).
Average the two recorded measurements and add 0.016. This total gives you a shim pack thickness to start the end play measurement. Combine the shims to equal the total shim pack measurement.
Remove the front bearing cover and coat the shim pack.
Position the shims and front bearing cover on the case ( Figure 183).

figure.caption: Figure 183. Position Shims and Front Bearing Cover on Case, and Install Retaining Nuts

step1.para: Install the retaining bolts and tighten to 15 to 25 ft-lbs. (20 to 34 N• m) ( Figure 183).
Place the transmission in the vertical position ( Figure 184).

figure.caption: Figure 184. Place Transmission in Vertical Position and Temporarily Install Yoke and Output Shaft Nut

step1.para: Temporarily install the yoke and output shaft nut. Tighten nut to 300 to 350 ft-lbs. (407 to 475 N• m) ( Figure 184).
Rotate the output shaft and mainshaft six (6) times clockwise and six (6) times counterclockwise to seat the bearings and races ( Figure 184).
Position the dial indicator on the output shaft end ( Figure 185).

figure.caption: Figure 185. Position Dial Indicator on Output Shaft End and Measure End Play

step1.para: Pry up on the output shaft to measure end play ( Figure 185). End play must be set per the following:
Remove shims for less end play and add shims for more end play.
Remove output shaft nut, yoke and rear bearing cover. Coat the shims.
Position the shims and rear bearing cover on the case ( Figure 186). Rear bearing cover top is marked for proper positioning.

figure.caption: Figure 186. Position Shims and Rear Bearing Cover on Case and Install Retaining Nuts

step1.para: Install retaining nuts and tighten to 60 to 70 ft-lbs. (81 to 95 N• m) ( Figure 186).

note.para: Make sure the nuts are properly tightened, the output shaft rotates, and the end play is within specification.
